newsitem.title: FRANCE: Thomson-CSF wins two French defence deals.
newsitem.headline: Thomson-CSF wins two French defence deals.

text.p: Thomson-CSF said on Tuesday its unit Thomson-CSF Airsys had won two contracts from the French defence procurement agency (DGA) for the future "Martha" air defence programme.
No value was given for the contracts.
Thomson-CSF said in a statement that the awarding of the contracts was a "clear illustration of Thomson-CSF Airsys' strengths in air defence coordination".
"Martha" is the French acronymn for interconnection of tactical radars and weapons systems for anti-aircraft defence.
It is a mobile tactical system aimed at coordinating the French army's air defence infrastructure, improving fire efficiency and increasing protection of friendly aircraft.
